intro: Diplusodon lythroides var. villosissimus, commonly known as the hairy false heather, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
